titles.title: HP741 My gracious Lord, I own thy right

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
My gracious Lord, I own thy right
To every service I can pay;
And call it my supreme delight
To hear thy dictates and obey.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
What is my being, but for thee,
Its sure support, its noblest end,
Thy ever-smiling face to see,
And serve the cause of such a friend?

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
I would not live for worldly joy,
Or to increase my worldly good,
Nor future days or powers employ
To spread a sounding name abroad:

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
'Tis to my Saviour I would live,
To him who for my ransom died;
Nor could untainted Eden give
Such bliss as blossoms at his side.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines:
His work my hoary age shall bless,
When youthful vigour is no more,
And my last hour of life confess
His love has animating power.
